refined_action_summary: Your forehand clear needs improvement in arm positioning and wrist backswing. Focus on raising the upper-lower arm angle in setup, increasing wrist hinge in backswing, and fully extending the arm at impact to generate power.

setup.refined_suggestion: Raise your elbow and open the shoulder to achieve an upper-lower arm angle near 99°, keeping the racket at shoulder height before initiating the swing.

backswing.refined_suggestion: Hinge the wrist further by rotating the forearm backward while maintaining stable elbow height to store more potential energy.

power.refined_suggestion: Drive through the shuttle with a fully extended arm at impact, aiming for near 180° to maximize power transfer.

improvement_drills: Slow-motion forehand clears focusing on achieving correct arm angle from setup through follow-through
Wrist hinge exercises to increase backswing range
Shadow swings emphasizing full arm extension at impact point
next_steps: Record a new video after drills to compare arm angles and backswing improvements
